page.title: 20COURTHOUSE
page.content:
The{COURTHOUSE}originally contained two courts and offices designed in 1874 by{Thomas Henry Wyatt {.Only one}remains after a disastrous fire in 1944.The courthouse is situated at the end of{Maryport {Street, close to Priory Gardens}. It was first an{Assize Court},then a{Sessions court}and now a{Magistrates {court}with four people working there. It serves the{Usk area}and sits twice a month,with sixty cases being heard. { Magistrates}are appointed for the people of the town,three act as the {Judges}in the Magistrates Court but serious offences are committed to the nearest Crown Court
.
